aaEndingKat
Despite the objections of a few citizens, Miss Kat was buried with full honors, alongside the other fallen defenders.
aaEndingMayor
Brandon would live out the rest of his days in obscurity, dying penniless and alone.
When the deacon caught Brandon in the act, he strangled the former mayor to death. It would be ruled as self-defense.
His term as mayor would eventually be commemorated with an ornate toilet constructed in the town hall.
aaEndingSullivan
Mourned by his peers, Sullivan was buried alongside the other defenders, his name included in a memorial for the fallen.
Though a valued employee, he would eventually be laid off when the mine dried up. After leaving Silverwood, he was never seen again.
He would be buried in a nondescript grave outside of town.
He would go on to train some of the most successful prize fighters in New Reno.
So what do you do for fun?
Fun? Well, if I'm not on a job, I love a sip of good scotch, the company of a beautiful woman, or a game of poker. Fuck Caravan.
Only thing about poker is that I can be a little... cantankerous if things don't go my way.
Last time I played, some asshole beat my flush with four jacks. Bullshit, right? He started laughing, so I smashed a bottle over his head.
I was forcefully escorted from the premises, asked not to return. As if I was the first motherfucker to fight in that shithole. Ridiculous.
A wife? You fucking high? No, just... one girl, Mary. Haven't thought about her in... five years? She was special, but it wasn't in the cards.
Do you have a girlfriend or wife somewhere?
I do the job, but I don't get my rocks off by killing people.
Yeah, whatever you say.
I think you and I are on the same page. It's a rush like no other.
That's it, partner. Good to know that we think alike on this issue.
set aaRussellQuest.Loyalty to aaRussellQuest.Loyalty +1
aaRussellAskBountyBusinessEnjoyKillingCheckSpeech
By the time I was eighteen, I had over twenty confirmed kills. The fact is... I excelled at killing people, and the rangers respected me for it.
I started with the rangers as a beat-up, starving kid with no prospects. When I discovered my talent for killing, it gave me an identity.
The first part of my life was spent in chains, subserviant to another person, with no will of my own.
When I learned I could alter a man's place in this world, snuff him out, it was the first time I felt power. I would never be a slave again.
Sorry if I've upset your delicate sensibilities, but I won't apologize for killing my enemies, nor for being damn good at it.
I'm not judging you, but the way you talk about it is a little unsettling.
You've got good instincts. I'm glad you won't hesitate.
You can't, not ever. You start trying to make excuses for the other guy, he'll take advantage of the opportunity, and then you're dead.
I'm working with a psychopath. Great.
You're a fucking hypocrite.
set aaRussellQuest.Loyalty to aaRussellQuest.Loyalty -1
aaRussellAskBoone01Speech
Fine, it's your crew. I'll knock it off. Just don't expect me to be fucking friends with the guy.
set aaRussellQuest.Boone to 5
Boone is a valuable part of this team, and your remarks are undermining our cohesion. Stop it.
Having a beef with the Legion is hardly anything special around here. The man is an uptight prick, and I've got every right to voice my opinion.
You and Boone both hate the Legion. Why can't you just focus on your common interests?
Fuck with Boone again, and I'll cook off the rest of your face over a campfire.
You're serious? Fuck me! Christ, I... I just didn't know, ok? I'll stop! Not another word, I promise.
set aaRussellQuest.Boone to 5
aaRussellAskBooneGuns
The guys has good eyes and poise, I'll give him that. I didn't realize you relied on him so much. I'll take it down a notch, chief.
set aaRussellQuest.Boone to 5
Boone is an expert spotter and an accomplished marksman, and you know it. We need him.
Nevermind.
aaRussellMaryWho
She was a caravan guard that I met not long after the treaty, when I was earning my salt as a hired gun. She had hair black as a dream.
She was tough... hardest fucking woman I ever met, easily could've been a ranger. That's what I loved about her... she didn't compromise.
I had little interest in guarding caravans until I met her, then I suddenly became invested in the affair. She noticed.
She called me "Rojo", cause of the beard. Not many redheads where she came from, further south. Fuck, I still remember her eyes.
We were close, but not an actual item. It was strictly physical, according to her. Just a passing pleasure out in the wilds.
See, she already had a man, Faulk. He was a fat fuck who ran the company. Nice guy, but a fucking pussy. He had money, though.
I'm the bad guy, you see? The ugly, crazy bastard that you fuck for fun, but never consider settling down with.
Once Faulk proposed to her it was a done deal, we had to go our separate ways. I asked her to change her mind... but I wouldn't beg.
Maybe I should've begged, just tossed any semblance of pride to the wind... but she might have just laughed at me. God, I loved that bitch.
No point dwelling on it now. After all, I'll always have my whores.
So, who was Mary?
Why did you shoot that man?
I'm afraid that Ike was in the middle of a dreadful losing streak, and he elected to blame me for his misfortune.
The poor soul... he was just too high-strung.
Why do they call you 'Doc'?
Before the war I was an orthodontist, and while I've ceased practicing, I still enjoy using the title.
It lends weight to the name, don't you agree?
I'm trying to collect the bounty on Red Bear. Do you have any information that could help?
I need information on Red Bear, zombie. Start talking!
What an ugly thing to say.
startcombat player setenemy aadocfridayfaction playerfaction 0 0 setenemy playerfaction aadocfridayfaction 0 0
Where can I find this guy?
Only inside the bowels of a heavily guarded bunker. It's an unappealing route to Red Bear, but it's a route nonetheless.
Here's the location. Meston should have documentation of his dealings with Red Bear.
I'm not privy to the details, but they have been trading for at least a decade.
Anything else you can tell me about Meston and Shadow Company?
They call them "Shadow Company" for a reason. It's a crude, yet accurate description of their secretive nature.
Various factions rely on them because they conduct all operations with the utmost confidentiality.
As for Meston, I don't know much about the man, other than he has a tremendous capacity for physical violence.
Rumor has it that the company's profits finance his implants and other unnatural augmentations to the body.
And where you find Meston, you'll find his rabid lackey, Mr. Joshua. He's a vicious little cur, and utterly loyal to Meston.
I see I haven't dissuaded you. If you manage to survive, I hope you return to the saloon and visit a bit.
And one more thing - if you are going to pursue this in earnest, I'd advise you to consult with Mr. Dent, the gentleman sitting at the bar.
I believe he's had dealings with Shadow Company in the past, although they were anything but amicable. Farewell, and good luck.
setstage aaBounties02 18 setobjectivedisplayed aaBounties02 16 1
Do you have any information on Arthur Ribben?
I never met him, but I had the chance to interact with his contemporaries.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([08038180]aaSecondary14) Lathe Biosas EmotionType : Happy

ESP.ORIGINAL: Whatever crimes the Enclave perpetrated, I was always impressed by their fastidious approach to oral hygiene, every last one of them.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([08038180]aaSecondary14) Lathe Biosas EmotionType : Happy

ESP.ORIGINAL: As for Captain Ribben, I understand he assisted with horrific experiments while serving under Lieutenant Colonel Charles Curling.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([08038180]aaSecondary14) Lathe Biosas EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: By all accounts, Captain Ribben was quite enthusiastic, but fortunately for all of us, some "Chosen One" stopped the whole affair.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([08038180]aaSecondary14) Lathe Biosas EmotionType : Disgust

ESP.ORIGINAL: I've never quite fathomed the appellations in such legends. Who chose this "one"? I certainly didn't.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([08038180]aaSecondary14) Lathe Biosas EmotionType : Surprise

ESP.ORIGINAL: Pardon me, you didn't inquire into my opinions on wasteland myths. To return to the matter at hand, I have no idea where Captain Ribben might be.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([08038180]aaSecondary14) Lathe Biosas EmotionType : Happy

ESP.ORIGINAL: A few rumors persist, and they're dubious at best.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([08038180]aaSecondary14) Lathe Biosas EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: One traveler purported that Ribben was now a wild man in the Spring Mountains, and had spawned a pack of feral orphans to do his bidding.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([08038180]aaSecondary14) Lathe Biosas EmotionType : Disgust

ESP.ORIGINAL: Stranger things have happened, but I'm skeptical nonetheless. In the meantime, I will drink to your success, and bid you good luck in this manhunt.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([08038180]aaSecondary14) Lathe Biosas EmotionType : Happy

ESP.ORIGINAL: Ok, one thousand caps it is. We have a deal.
Excellent! You've made the right choice. And don't worry - this stays between us. You stay safe out there!
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Adam Rzeznik [0803BEE4] (mod) Quest : ([0803BEE3]aaSecondary15) A Weed that Grows on Every Soil EmotionType : Happy

ESP.ORIGINAL: set aaSecondary15.RzeznikGreeted to 11 player.additem caps001 1000 player.rewardkarma -50 setstage aaSecondary15 180
aaRzeznikDoorRef.lock 101 Player.moveto RzeznikTPMarker
I don't accept bribes. This is your last chance.
No, that was your last chance. I'm sorry we couldn't do business together. Goodbye.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Adam Rzeznik [0803BEE4] (mod) Quest : ([0803BEE3]aaSecondary15) A Weed that Grows on Every Soil EmotionType : Anger

ESP.ORIGINAL: startcombat player setenemy aaRzeznikFaction PlayerFaction
aaRzeznikDoorRef.lock 101 Player.moveto RzeznikTPMarker
<Bribe Barter Check>
Huh, I really underestimated you. Ok, two thousand caps it is. Now get the hell out of here before you run me out of business, you thief!
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Adam Rzeznik [0803BEE4] (mod) Quest : ([0803BEE3]aaSecondary15) A Weed that Grows on Every Soil EmotionType : Anger

ESP.ORIGINAL: set aaSecondary15.RzeznikGreeted to 11 player.additem caps001 2000 player.rewardkarma -50 setstage aaSecondary15 180
aaRzeznikDoorRef.lock 101 Player.moveto RzeznikTPMarker
Make it two thousand and I'm in.
What's your story, Doc?
I grew up before the war, and was blessed with a strong upbringing and a classical education. Both have served me well in these troubled times.
My father died when I was rather young, so my brother Joseph and I were close. That was a lifetime... two lifetimes ago.
Joseph was taken from me before the war. I don't normally like to speak of it, but it's been so long.
Joseph was the sheriff in our hometown. What he lacked in loquacity he made up for in decisiveness.
He was an honest man - more honest than I ever was, at least. He was a rock - I thought he could never die.
One weekend a drifter made his way into town, and for no apparent reason killed Joseph. He shot him in the back, they said.
The state police eventually found the perpetrator, a man by the name of Johnny Rounder. He was tried and sentenced to death.
He sat on death row for two years, and after countless appeals and delays the execution date was finalized: October 24, 2077.
It was a day too late, as things turned out. The airbursts over Ft. Benning produced enough radiation to kill almost everyone shortly afterwards.
I watched my family wither away... my own son turning pale, his hair falling out, crying... I wanted to die with them, but I lingered on.
I fell asleep next to my wife as she died, and prayed to die with her. Instead, the next morning I woke up looking at Johnny Rounder.
He was holding Joseph's badge, admiring it like it was a long-lost trophy. He had already changed.
He just looked at me and said, "Now you've got something to live for, Doc," and then walked away.
I've been following that bastard for two hundred years, and it's going to end here. I can feel it.
How did you know Steven Randall?
I was wanted for questioning in regards to a minor altercation in the adjacent territory. Randall was prompted by his employers to pursue me.
Randall was very professional about the whole affair, and realizing I was a fellow southerner, he was willing to discuss the matter.
We settled it with a card game, which I handily won. Randall was a gentleman about the affair, and left it at that.
In case you're wondering whether I cheated, I'll say this - any man who wouldn't cheat when gambling for his freedom is a damn fool.
It's simply a shame what happened to Randall. He carried himself with a rare combination of strength and calm. He was very poised.
And I can tell you that if your profession depends on using a gun, poise counts for more than anything.
Have you ever heard of "Mr. Fisk"?
Yes, he's a key figure in an organized crime syndicate. Supposedly he had extensive dealings with that corpulent pervert, The Judge.
The prevailing rumor is that Mr. Fisk has come under significant pressure from his own superiors since you've disrupted their interests.
If Mr. Fisk is removed, it would only exacerbate the power vacuum rendered by the Judge's demise.
I certainly wouldn't shed tears for either of those bastards, but I worry who might replace them. Nature abhors a vacuum.
Do you know anything about a man named Sergio?
He's a veritable psychopath who places engraved harmonicas in the mouths of slain opponents.
How he acquires such a steady supply of harmonicas and the means to engrave them is beyond me, but that is his monikor.
He was born from the same putrid stock as Marko, so villainy is in his bloodlines.
Do you know anything about Marko?
He is an ill-bred, flagitious cur bent on pillaging and destruction. Despite his bucolic origins, he possesses considerable intelligence and cunning.
I saw him on one occasion in the town of Dalhart, a dusty stopover on the plains. He was trading in hides and chattel, an accepted practice there.
His eyes said it all - he had a stare that was more barren and dehumanized than that irradiated steppe. He was young, but I knew what he was.
He has long since been a pestilence in those parts, though I estimate he is aging by now. It's been... thirty years since I saw him that time.
If the law doesn't catch him, then time will, my friend.
Two hundred years and you still haven't killed him? What gives?
We've killed each other several times over, if you're measuring pain. He had experience with a pistol, and was able to outduel me... at first.
For years, it was just a game... he'd leave me broken and bleeding in some remote spot. But in time the games stopped.
It was around 2190, I think... we were somewhere in Texas, someplace where they still had trees, near Louisiana.
I caught him coming out of the saloon, but it wasn't some craven ambush. I looked him in the eyes first, and then I put a .357 slug in his gut.
He mangled my arm, and managed to get away, thanks to his gang. We've faced off at least a dozen times since then, but never with any resolution.
For the last few years he's been running a gang outside the NCR and Legion's respective territories.
However, with the regional power players and the Judge gone, there is opportunity for a ruthless prick like Johnny.
Besides, I know how he thinks. He'll be here, sooner rather than later. If not for the power, than for me.
If you ever get a lead on him, look me up. I'd do anything to get another shot at him.
set aaScullDialogue.DocExplained to 1
Since I'm going after him, do you have any more information on Johnny?
He's certainly not lacking in manual celerity, but since I wounded him that time, he can't summon enough courage to face me alone.
Regardless, it would be a fatal error to underestimate him. When the time for action arrives, festina lente.
You're no stranger to violence, so you'll be fine once the shooting starts.
I retrieved your brother's badge from Johnny Rounder.
I never thought I would see this again. I've never had many friends, courier, but I'd be honored to be yours.
People talk about you, you know? A veritable dealer of death, through-and-through, so they say.
I hung up my bounty hunting hat long ago, but hearing the tales they tell of you, makes me... excited, once again.
If ever you should need assistance, friend, my gun is yours. All you have to do is say the word, and we shall journey into legend together!

player.removeitem aaFridayBadge 1 setobjectivecompleted aaSecondary21 20 1 player.rewardkarma 50 if aaDocFridayQuest.bDocHireable != 1 Set aaScullDialogue.DocBefriended to 1 set aaDocFridayQuest.bDocHireable to 1 endif
I need to get going.
Bye.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: I need to get going.
{whimper}<whimper>
That's all for now, boy.
aaEpilogue07ChucklesIntercomChamber01Finish
Look at that, Poopsie! This one has a brain!
I'd like to ask you something.
Then by all means, ask away.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Happy

ESP.ORIGINAL: I'd like to ask you something else.
What else can I tell you?
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: What's your opinion of the NCR?
It was good while it lasted, but Tandi's dream is fading, I'm afraid. The republic is simply too big for its britches.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: Don't get me wrong, I've got a real soft spot for the NCR, but I don't see it expanding past the Mojave, at least not for a while.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: Personally, I find myself wondering what else is out there. I mean, the Legion will fade away soon enough. What's in Texas? Dixie? The Midwest?
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: The NCR can handle the Legion, but I'm not sure if it could handle someone with their shit together, using real weaponry. Oh, well.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: What's your opinion of Mr. House?
Before the war, I always suspected House was a species of pervert. There's no telling what type of debauchery he's engaged in up in that tower.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Disgust

ESP.ORIGINAL: He seemed the sort of man who fancied himself god, or at least god-like. Though there's no denying his brilliance, his hubris is worrisome.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: What will you do after the Second Battle of Hoover Dam?
Given my state, I try not to ponder the far future. Some people envy ghouls for our longevity, but even that has its drawbacks.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: Unless Lanius and his army of skirts sweeps through, I will stay put. The Mojave suits me, and I would be loathe to abscond prematurely.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Happy

ESP.ORIGINAL: What's your opinion of the Legion?
They're a gang of catamites who ritually sodomize each other with broomsticks. That is the prevailing rumor, anyway.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: I hear travelers and traders laud the Legion from afar, citing security. They haven't seen a man crucified or children branded like cattle.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Anger

ESP.ORIGINAL: I have, I won't forget it. Malo periculosam libertatem quam quietum servitium. I'll take dangerous liberty over peaceful slavery any day.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: How do you feel about being a ghoul?
Some ghouls constantly bemoan their state, droning on about their decay and prejudice by "smoothskins". I could give a damn what people think.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Happy

ESP.ORIGINAL: I will outlive the bigots, and anyone bold enough to upbraid me in public will find themselves in an... unenviable position.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: I hear the grumblings of fanaticism from Jacob Powers and his sort, crying for a ghoul revolution. Hogwash, all of it. He's just a criminal.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: Sadly, courtesy is a fading commodity in the wastes, so I try to dispense it equally to both human and ghoul alike. That is all I have to say on it.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Happy

ESP.ORIGINAL: What's up with Kate? She doesn't say much.
She's a sweet soul, but unfortunately, English is not her first language. How she came to arrive in North America is still a mystery to me.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: I would venture to guess that she is of Slavic extraction. I honestly don't know. Our interactions are largely of a... physical nature.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: With Sergio out of the picture, do you think we'll see a drop-off in banditry?
Firstly, please accept my heartfelt thanks for slaying that animal. To answer your question, I would venture to say... maybe.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Happy

ESP.ORIGINAL: The big-name outlaws know that they're marked men out here, so they'll steer clear. However, some crazies can't be deterred.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Surprise

ESP.ORIGINAL: Pardon the cliche, but nature abhors a vacuum, and that's what we have now. Somebody will step in to fill it soon enough, mark my words.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: Did you ever meet Ulysses in any of your travels?
I'd like to forget him. We nearly came to blows in a saloon near Pahrump. He was the most self-important jackass I've ever met.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: He couldn't play poker without blathering about politics. If they had given Ulysses an enema, he could have been buried in a matchbox.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: He began moaning about dead nations, and I told him that if he'd been around before the war, we'd have tossed him in a padded room.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: On top of it all, there were vermin residing in his weaves. Every time he sneezed, lice littered the card table. It was revolting.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Disgust

ESP.ORIGINAL: Oh, and he refused to doff his mask, so he was doubly indiscernible during the game. After losing a score of denarii, he shambled back outside.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: That was the first and last time I saw Ulysses.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: Who's the toughest person you ever met?
Hmm... I'll have to weigh that. Toughest might be another ghoul I met once, NCR Ranger by the name of Watson. Quiet, surly bastard.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: Folks talk about Joshua Graham and the Judge, but I'd wager that Watson would scalp those twits in a heartbeat. Cold eyes and steady hands.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: Wasn't around him long, but it was enough to feel him out. Something was off about him... not malign, but just... secretive.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: What's odd is that his partner is the most bombastic, drunken fool I've ever met, another ranger named Josey. He pissed himself and started a brawl.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: Watson and Josey were good friends, though. You couldn't cross one without agitating the other. Suffice to say Josey did most of the agitating.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Neutral

ESP.ORIGINAL: You don't seem to like Guts. What's the problem?
I was silent out of politeness, but since you're inquiring... he's a drooling, hair-hacking meatbag, constantly pissing and growling.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Disgust

ESP.ORIGINAL: That mongrel makes a habit of trying to copulate with my shins, staining my trousers in the process. You'd be better off with a goat.
ESP.COMMENTAIRE: NPC : Doc Friday [0800159B] (mod) Quest : ([080A3EF7]aaDocFridayQuest) Doc Friday Companion Quest EmotionType : Anger

<pant pant pant>
That's all for now, Cooper.
I want to talk about something else.
<pant pant pant>
I'd like to ask you a question.
Yeah, sure thing.
<Story Topic>
I came up on the family ranch west of New Reno, up in the mountains, you know? It wasn't too much different from here, actually.
I was in the middle of like, seven kids. I had to toughen up quick. People stopped pushing me soon enough, since I was a regular ass-kicker.
Herding bighorners ain't no life for a killer like me. I left the ranch a few years back, set out guarding caravans and hunting down bounties.
When I heard that the famous Steven Randall was tracking down Marko, I knew right away where I needed to be. It's my destiny to help you kill Marko.
set aaFordQuest.bStory to 1
Where are you from?
What do you hope to gain from bounty hunting?
There's the caps, enough to set me up for life. I heard you getting all rich from Randall's bounty hunting back in Vegas.
After all this is done, I'm gonna be neck-deep in pussy, no question about it. Girls love confidence. I might even start my own bounty hunting firm.
I might even let you work for me when I get everything set up. Of course, I'd be the fucking boss, and I wouldn't take none of this mercy nonsense.
We'd be the greatest bounty hunting business in history! We might even kill Lanius himself!
How can I make the best use of your skills?
I grew up shooting geckos on the farm, so I'm pretty good with a gun. I'm actually one of the best shots around. That's what everybody else tells me.
I can use a blade, too. This one time, I was visiting this saloon, and there were like three hobos... and they all jumped me!
I was all like, pht, pht, pht, yeah, you want some of this? And they were like, "Oh, no, don't kill me. You're so cool."
set aaFordQuest.bKiller to 1
Because of my balls, that's why. I'm also fucking smart. I'm talking street smart. I'm a goddamn street genius, I can read people a mile away.
One day I'll be remembered as the greatest killer ever, maybe even better than you and Randall. You wait and see.
set aaFordQuest.bKiller to 3
Why do you think you're such an effective killer?
This is some kind of like... a fucking test, isn't it? You're trying to mind-fuck me with proctology? I'm a born killer, nothing else for me to do.
People talk about rangers and centurions, they don't scare me. You know I kicked the shit out of a ranger once?
It was in a bar outside Reno. Some ranger came in, started laying hands on the bartender, Pam. I told him to knock it off.
He said, "I'm a Ranger, you little maggot." And I told him, "I'm Ford, the famous bounty hunter." I could tell he was scared.
He went for his pistol, but I shot it out of his hand. So we squared off, and he gave me his best shot!
Pow! Right in my kisser. I didn't even flinch. Then I gave him the palm strike of death, like this! <He twirls about while flailing his arms>
I could've broken his neck, but I held back. One hit was all it took to knock him out. Then Pam kissed me, and we fucked in her room. Rangers, pfft.
set aaFordQuest.bKiller to 4
Have you ever considered doing something other than bounty hunting? You might not be cut out for it.
How do you feel about working for the NCR?
It's the best. I would've enlisted, but I have a minor asthma condition. Doesn't mean I can't hack it, though. Nobody fucks with me.
The best thing about the NCR is freedom. You accept it, or we'll fuck you in the ass. Pretty soon we're going to fuck the Legion, too. You watch.
Man, they're all pussies except the bear. NCR is a fucking supertastic system that will bring law and order, and I'm going to help them.
Sister's Legion is a bunch of fucking weirdos who stick rods up their asses for pleasure. They better not try that on me, or I'll fuck them first.
Yeah, I heard about this guy named House. He drinks piss and throws puppies from some tower in New Vegas. True fucking story.
What do you think of the different factions in the Mojave?
You're trying to like, mind-fuck me, aren't you? Won't work. I am the greatest mind-fucker of all time.
I have so much fucking charisma that random women just walk up and ask permission to suck my cock. I'm a giant fucking pussy magnet, I can't help it.
I have to ask - do you really believe the things you're saying?
They learned to fear me right from the start since I'm a killer. I'm not afraid to criticize em', either. They respect my advice, because I am smart.
One time this guy got in my face cause I told him he was dressed like a girl. I punched him in the balls and he started crying like a bitch.
Nobody fucks with me, cause they know I'll punch them in them in the dick, if they're lucky. Piss me off good and I'll show you my killer side.
How do you get along with the other bounty hunters?
I have the spirit of a deathjaw, and when I'm stirred up good and proper I'll unleash the animal inside me. Nothing can stop me then.
It's like I'm possessed by some demon, and I just kill everything I see. All my enemies piss their pants and flee, sort of like in the novels.
I'm a mind-fucking whirlwind of bullets and mayhem, sent by Jesus Christ to make the world right. It is in the bible.
What is this "Killer Side"?
Because I'm the fucking best! I've seen and done it all. People should be honored when I take a shit on them. End of story.
My words are like gold nuggets that I shoot from my dick with the speed of a tornado, smashing your face with truth. {Pleased with himself}Yeah.
Why are you so critical of everyone and everything around you?
I'm scared of Jesus and {Struggling to recall name}Doctor... Doctor Duluth? I can't remember his name. They say he roams the wastes with deathjaws and zombies at his side.
I hear he hunts children and rapes them in power armor, then sends roaches to eat their corpses. True fucking story. That shit scares me.
{Regaining confidence}You know, of course, I'd still kill him. I'd shoot his dick off and make him eat it, just like that other guy.
Is there anyone that you're afraid of?
Your braggadocio suggests a raging superiority complex. You need to take it down a notch.
What? Look, you can stow all your fancy book learnings. I am from the school of hard knocks, I don't need no book smarts.
Whatever, bub.
No whatever about it. One day I'm gonna be the best bounty hunter who ever lived. Then they'll be writing dime novels about me. You'll see.
I understand you completely.
I knew you would. One day, when I'm king of this wasteland I'll make sure to remember how you accepted my wisdom in these moments.
You're a disease.
If there was a disease making you badass, you'd be right. Maybe that's exactly what I am. I infect people with fear because they know I'm a killer.
Please explain how you'll kill Marko.
It's gonna be just like in the novels. We'll meet in a street, and he'll have my girlfriend hostage. You know, I don't have one yet, but I will soon.
He'll say, "You can't beat me, Ford. I heard you're a dangerous killer, but I have Satan in this pistol." And I won't even flinch.
I'll say, "The forces of evil won't save you, evildoer." He'll draw, but I'll be faster, and I'll put a bullet right through his heart.
Then I'll whip out my footlong cock and begin pissing on his face and I'll be like, "This is for Randall, you devil worshipper!"
He'll be all like, "That's the biggest dick I've ever seen. You won." My girlfriend will fling herself at me and we'll fuck right on top of his body!
I've come to realize that most everything you say is unadulterated bullshit.
Very funny. My older brother Tommy used to call me a liar until I did a roundhouse kick to his throat. You wanna see my kick? <He flails about>
That's just disgusting, even if it is a complete lie.
You can't handle the hard, gritty reality of it. I thought you were a real bounty hunter. Maybe you're going soft.
Thanks for clarifying that.
You got it, anytime.
I'm pretty familiar with ballistic trauma inflicted by shotguns, and your story is ludicrous.
You weren't even there. He ate his own dick, swallowed like it was a bloody hot dog. The whole town saw it, and they were cheering.

aaTBAEndingCutty

{Cutty and Cocker both survive - publish book and resume cutting hair}Having defended their position and survived against overwhelming odds, Cocker and Cutty emerged from battle with a new lease on life.
aaTBANarratorREF.SayTo Player aaTBAEndingCutty

aaTBANarratorREF.SayTo Player aaTBAEndingCutty

{Cocker dies - Cutty starts charity for wounded and homeless veterans}Cutty was never again seen in NCR, but the legend of a murderous mutant who quietly butchered Legionaries would endure for years in Arizona.

aaTBANarratorREF.SayTo Player aaTBAEndingCourier
How's the army treating you?
Well, imagine that you're like, a puppy. Really happy... and then a bunch of ants start ripping your skin off and eating you alive.
Oh, and it's fucking hot, and you get fed shit all the time. That pretty much sums it up.
Look, I don't want to insult you, but that's a pretty fucking stupid question. I could have snowmen there. It was nice and cold.
People complain about cold... all you got to do is put a fucking jacket on.
Here, a hundred fucking thousand degrees, you could be butt ass naked and you're still gonna feel like you're in the pits of hell!
No fucking snowmen...I can't even build a fucking sand castle-man-person-thing! I fucking miss my snowmen.
You miss Frosthill?
What have you been up to since you left Utah?
It's basically been a lot of marching and waiting, and being treated like a piece of shit most of the time, yeah, that's basically what it is.
aaCuttyCutHair
Absolutely! I really miss cutting hair. This is gonna be great!
showbarbermenu
I'd like a haircut.
aaCockerCutHair
Just tell me how you want it, and I'll make it happen!
showbarbermenu
I'd like a haircut.
You feeling all right about the battle?
Sure! I'm just gonna face certain death for a bunch of hobos that probably hate and despise me as a supermutant, but fuck it, that's life, right?
In all seriousness, I've been through worse. Remember, I was in the Master's fucking army... bunch of guys in skirts throwing spears... kiss my ass!
What was that? Sorry, I've got this ringing shit in my hear, I can't fucking hear anything. Goddamn, that was crazy.
Hey, thanks for sticking it out with us. You know, I don't know if we'd have made it without you, so... really, thank you, and...
You ever need a haircut, just look me up in some place where it's hot and shitty, and you'll find me there, most likely.
I guess this is it. I'm heading back to the Mojave.
I gotta bury my friend now... then I'm gonna kill some fucking Legion. Goodbye.
I guess this is it. I'm heading back to the Mojave.
You ready for this?
I guess the best part about dying... is that I won't have to be in this fucking shithole next to Cutty anymore. So yes, I'm fucking ready.
Am I holding up okay? Well, I've got shrapnel in my ass... and I've been shot at, nearly had my head cut off...
And now Cutty's farting again in the foxhole. So yes, I guess I'm A-fucking-okay.
Excuse me, just a little battle fatigue, as they say. Thank you for your help. You need anything, just look me up. Take care of yourself.
You holding up okay?
Cutty's dead. Nothing more to say. Goodbye.
You holding up okay?
aaKOTRAnnounceEnd
{Successful TITLE DEFENSE}Ladies and gentlemen, we have a winner... the champ!

You got it.
That's all for now.
aaSaveBradley01
Look, I don't want to waste your time or mine. Are you sure about this?
I might be able to make a Chem that'll make you appear dead. That should be enough to fool them.
aaSaveBradleyYES
Fuck, I... Can't see straight...

Russell's Perk
This perk contains a collection of buffs for Russell.
Swift Strike

One of Russell's most valuable skills is his ability to always be quick on his feet. While Russell is a companion, you move 10% faster while sneaking or aiming. In addition to this, you will also deliver 15% additional damage with all rifles, Russell's weapons of choice.
Last Stand
With Bradley as your companion, your chance to land a critical hit increases by 10% for every 10% you are below your maximum health.
Follow Your Nose
With Cooper at your side, you'll smell enemies coming from miles off! While Cooper is your companion, you can detect enemies on your compass from 10% further away.
Faithful Companion
With Guts by your side, you can detect threats from 5% further away and can run 5% faster. What a good boy!
Champ
I am the greatest! As the reigning champion, you deal 15% additional Unarmed damage.
Bloodshot
Doc Friday has mastered the arts of both healing and killing. With Doc Friday as your companion, your health will be restored by 5% for every kill you make.
Luck Beats Skill

Ford must have been blessed with a great amount of luck to have survived, and thrived, in the Bounty Hunting world. While Ford is a companion, your Luck is increased by 1 and your chance to land critical hits and the damage they deal are both increased by 10%.
Scarred

As a result of your scars inflicted by Marko, your rate of fire with Guns is decreased by 10% and your gun draw speed will also be decreased by 25%, however you will also now deal 10% more damage with all types of Guns.
Avenged
You used Sweet Revenge to finally put an end to Marko's evil, avenging Randall, his family, and so many others. Sweet Revenge now deals 25% additional damage.
Having avenged Randall, you will now deal 25% additional damage with Sweet Revenge.
